INTRODUCTION TO THE EXERCISES/EXPERIMENTS
Player Name
SCORE: 0/15
YOUR UNKNOWN SAMPLE CODE IS:
Do you want to conduct a flame test?
Decision 1
Decision 2
Decision 3
Yes
No
What\'s next?
Precipitate the sample and Centrifuge.
Transfer the centrifugate/liquid to a centrifuge tube.
Would you like to proceed with the centrifugate or the residue?
Residue
Centrifugate
Wash sample (solids) with 10 drops of COLD distilled water. Add 2 drops of room temperature distilled water.
Heat in boiling water bath for 3 minutes with constant stirring. Centrifuge quickly and decant supernatant liquid while sample is HOT.
Add 3 drops of 1 M KI.
The acidity of the sample was tested via litmus paper test.
Next
Red litmus paper stayed red, while blue litmus paper stayed blue.
Centrifugate will be set aside.
Combine with the previous centrifugate.
Heat the liquid for 10 minutes in boiling water bath. Cool for 2 minutes in a cold water bath then add 6 M HCI dropwise until acidic.
The blue litmus paper turned red.
Take 2 drops of the liquid and place onto a centrifuge tube. Add 6 M HCI dropwise until acidic.
Add 2 mL distilled water, stir and heat for 10 minutes in a boiling water bath. Centrifuge and discard centrifugate/liquid.
Wash the residue/solids with 2 mL distilled water then add 10 drops of 6 M HCI. Stir and heat for two minutes. Discard any precipitates/solids.
What would you like to do?
3 drops of 0.1 M KSCN
10 drops of 6 M NaOH
Combine with 10 drops of the sample in a centrifuge tube.
Add 40 drops of 0.5 M ammonium oxalate. Stir thoroughly and centrifuge.
Heat to dryness again then cool for 5 minutes.
Transfer quantitatively into a centrifuge tube using minimal amounts of 12 M HCI.
Red litmus paper turned blue.
Add 40 drops of 0.5 M ammonium oxalate. Stir thoroughly and centrifuge.
Wash the precipitate with 10 drops of distilled water and dissolve the precipitate using 6 M HCI dropwise.
Heat to dryness in low heat the cool for 5 minutes.
Dissolve the residue in 5 drops of 6 M HCI and transfer quantitatively in a centrifuge tube using distilled water.
Blue litmus paper turned slightly red.
Cool for 1 minute by swirling in cold temperature then centrifuge.
Add 10 - 15 drops of 1% dimethylglyoxime (DMG).
Add 2 drops of 6 M acetic acid to make it slightly acidic.
Add 50 drops of 6 M NaOH using Pasteur pipet. Stir and centrifuge. Quickly transfer the centrifugate to a centrifuge tube.
Wash it twice with 10 drops of distilled water.
Add 6 drops of 6 M HCI then stir. Centrifuge and quickly transfer the centrifugate into a centrifuge tube. Discard the residue.
What would you like to add?
Add Sodium Sulfite.
Add 6 M acetic acid dropwise with stirring until slightly acidic.

Clean the platinum wire loop by dipping it into clean concentrated HCI then heating it over direct flames until the wire loop is red-hot. Repeat this process until the wire loop imparts no appreciable color to the flame.
Evaporate to about 2 drops of the centrifugate. Cool and discard any precipitates/solids formed.
Add 1 drops of concentrated HCI then dip the cleaned wire loop to the solution to be tested. Insert the wire loop into the oxidizing zone of the flame.
Observe the flame through blue filter.
Place 10 drops of this solution in an evaporating dish. Make it alkaline with 6 M NaOH, then add 2 more drops.
On the underside of a watchglass, attach a wet red litmus paper then use that watchglass to cover the dish. Warm the solution but do not boil.
